messages: 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:28): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: to be fair to ms, the classid and codebase attributes (and indeed the entire <object> element) might have been invented by ms before it was included in html4
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:29): what's in html4 doesn't match what they do
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:30): i don't understand the question
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:33): it's not a question
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:34): ie 'codebase' != html4 'codebase'
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:34): indeed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:34): so ie's attribute wasn't included in the html4 spec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:34): even if the name was used by ie before the spec came out
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:35): true, but if ms used the attribute name first it isn't their fault that it is in conflict with html4
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:36): that's what i meant
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:37): ...unless ms were in the html wg back then defining it

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:38): Chris said "the WHATWG HTML5 removes a few key attributes from the <object> element that were in HTML 4.01 - namely, classid and codebase - that are heavily used by ActiveX in IE", which is why it's relevant to say that IE isn't actually using those HTML 4.01 attributes
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:38): (independent of whose fault it is that the spec and the implementation disagree)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:41): hi everyone
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (23:51): "inline structure" reveals at least <code> and <abbr> it seems

ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (00:27): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, Interesting. Do you know how easy or hard that would be to implement?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:29): i can't believe chris honestly doesn't see how what he's doing is exactly what microsoft keeps doing to sustain their monopolies
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:29): sometimes people laugh at "don't be evil", but it's exactly this kind of thing that google's culture prevents
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (00:30): wonders what MS have  done now...
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:30): the versioning thing in the html list
